Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'People often describe time as a river—one down which we all flow, along which we swim toward a future full of uncertainty.'}
{3: 'This river has been coursing through the abyss way before humanity and the world itself existed.'}
{3: 'And it is now only through this river that humans manage to remember the occasional splashes of water leaping out of the river.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory17.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory17.jpg'}
{3: 'Thirteenth Avenue Aquatic Center. Please ensure that you have all your personal belongings with you when alighting.'}
{3: 'Clank. Clank...'}
{2: '???', 3: "Humans aren't as powerful as previously imagined... Advancing... Thinking..."}
{3: 'Layer after layer, strings of words with meanings make their way into your consciousness—before they ripple across your cerebral cortex and body.'}
{3: 'Right then, you sense a pull force that jerks you out of the pool of thoughts and boundless darkness...'}
{3: 'As you open your eyes, the first thing you see is the same polished car—along with the mysterious mechanoid.'}
{3: 'Caught in the middle of a heated argument, the mysterious mechanoid is surrounded by Bianca and Karenina, among everyone else.'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Conductor', 3: 'In the recurrence just now, I observed some very unusual emotional fluctuations in all of you—especially the two of you, Bianca and Karenina. Your emotional fluctuations were more violent than those of others.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Conductor', 3: "Such emotional fluctuations only ever appear alongside insignificant historical nodes, and yet... you all seem to see them as important. I have a hard time understanding such complicated fluctuations as they're not part of my database...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Conductor', 3: "Agony... joy... happiness... and sadness... are what I observed, and they don't make logical sense.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Conductor', 3: "These emotions are conflicting and contradicting, and I just don't understand how they can appear at the same time...", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Conductor', 3: 'Past records have shown that pain and sadness do nothing to help humanity progress collectively or individually, which is something human history and experience have proven time and time again...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The conductor seems to be having an internal struggle with itself.'}
{3: "It's failed to persuade everyone—including itself—and yet it doesn't seem like it's about to lend anyone an ear, either."}
{2: 'Conductor', 3: 'Experience and history tell us that humans never learn from history.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'That... is something we get to decide ourselves, though!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Conductor', 3: "Yes, you're free to voice your objections, but you have no right to interfere with the specifications of Gestalt's data.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bianca', 3: "What we have here isn't just some objection... but a conflict of ideology.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bianca', 3: "Those emotions probably didn't stir up the slightest bit of interest in you or Gestalt, but they mean the world to us.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Conductor', 3: "I just don't understand what you see in them...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: "That's what sets us apart from you. Simple as that.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Having those emotions in Gestalt's database or not probably makes no difference to you, but it does to us.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Because at the end of the day, you're nothing more than a program!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Conductor', 3: "...And that would be correct. I'm just a program, which is why I'm supposed to have precise objectives and means with which to accomplish my objectives.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Conductor', 3: 'And with that said, I was hoping that you would all be so kind as to once again demonstrate the meaning and value of said emotions.', 4: '1'}
